reviews.review_msg: Isn't very clear on expectations. An extremely high level of participation is needed to achieve over 50%. Does not enforce his own guideline requirements. No final is a plus, but found class disorganized and prof not very helpful. Much better if Bouchard teaches a larger class like 220, he's a great lecturer and TA's can clarify obscure criteria

Come on. He's hot. Enough said. Other than that he's incredibly interesting and smart. Our class was basically just a weekly discussion on things we thought were interesting about the articles we'd read which was a great format. Great teacher and great to look at.

Useless class. Completely disorganized and unstructured. Did not follow course outline, we didn't even know when to do the readings so ended up doing nothing in class but listen to him talk. Do not take this class if you want to learn anything other than the prof's life stories.
He'll offend you if you don't have a sense of humour. Be engaged and ask him questions about his previous research and experiences. Great professor overall.

Useless course. There was no real lecture entire class was based on his debates with his "fan club". He was way too politically charged and unwilling to consider other perspectives. If all you want is an easy "A" or "B" take his class... but this honestly shouldn't be your reason for pursuing post-secondary...

Very interesting course. Dr. Boyanowsky brings flavour into this course with his experience and expertise. Like the previous review, I also could not keep a straight face in class. Not sure why he is getting low marks but he is the man!!!
Boyanowsky is the man. He is hilarious, I couldnt keep a straight face during class.

Super interesting course and you learn a lot. Discussions were a lot of fun and everyone had plenty of opportunities to contribute. We could choose a topic for the term paper, which was also helpful and reflected our interests.

Dr. Lysova was a great prof to teach this course. However, the lectures were rushed and the seminars were based on 100+ pg readings. Other students got bad grade on participation but contrib equally. Exam and term paper was straightforward. Just read and study, state your opinions/examples too. Not taking 300W with her bc of course grading

Each seminar is rated on a 1-5 scale for participation, which makes up 25% of your overall grade. The main issues I have are that the readings are literally over 80+ pages of dry content a week, and the lectures are irrelevant, yet you have to attend for the sake of participation. Also, the midterm is 2 in-class six page essays. Wouldn't recommend.

She displays genuine interest in the subject. Her lectures are not the most interesting but they are not boring either. I felt like her class breakdown could have been better. I found she was ambiguous in what she wanted out of our work but really specific in her marking. You will have to work to get a good mark in the course.
